page.title: 02Cockernhoe J.M.I. School
page.content: Our school is now 104 years old.It is a small village school, with 56 children aged from 5 to 11 years.We have three classrooms. The Infants are taught by Miss Humphrey,the first year Juniors and Top Infants by Mrs.Cleaver and the other Juniors by Mrs.Edwards the Headmistress.Mrs.Stevens comes in two mornings a week to teach games and recorders to Juniors,and to help with the Infants.Mrs.Masters also takes the Juniors two mornings a week so Mrs.Edwards can do some office work.We have a secretary,Mrs.Ward,and a cook, Mrs.Crick who makes lovely meals like sausage pie and apple crumble.We start school at 8.45am.and do English and Maths until playtime,and then it's Science or Topic until lunch-time at noon.In the afternoons we have craft and P.E.On Tuesdays we have Library and in the summer we swim at Hitchin.
